text: Local elections were held in Malaya in 1962. They were dominated by the Alliance Party, which won 1,788 of the 2,419 seats available.Thomas Henry Silcock (1963) The Political Economy of Independent Malaya: A Case-study in Development, University of California Press, 1963, pp18–21 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !rowspan=2|State !colspan=3|Alliance !colspan=3|Socialist Front !colspan=3|PMIP !colspan=3|PPP !colspan=3|Others !rowspan=2|Total seats |- !Votes !% !Seats !Votes !% !Seats !Votes !% !Seats !Votes !% !Seats !Votes !% !Seats |- |align=left|Johore|| ||59.9||512|| || ||72|| || ||0|| || ||4|| || ||10||598 |- |align=left|Kedah|| ||57.4||231|| || ||11|| || ||16|| || ||0|| || ||8||266 |- |align=left|Kelantan|| ||43.0||88|| || ||0|| || ||119|| || ||0|| || ||0||207 |- |align=left|Negri Sembilan|| ||55.7||93|| || ||23|| || ||0|| || ||1|| || ||7||124 |- |align=left|Pahang|| ||66.8||214|| || ||19|| || ||1|| || ||0|| || ||9||243 |- |align=left|Perak|| ||47.8||460|| || ||240|| || ||0|| || ||226|| || ||20||730 |- |align=left|Perlis|| ||90.7||24|| || ||0|| || ||0|| || ||0|| || ||0||24 |- |align=left|Selangor|| ||54.8||166|| || ||46|| || ||0|| || ||4|| || ||11||227 |- |align=left|Total||–||–||1,788||–||–||195||–||–||136|| || ||4||–||–||11||2,419 |- |align=left colspan=17|Source: Silcock |} ==Local councils election== ===Province Wellesley=== ==References== 1962 Category:1962 in Malaya Category:1962 elections in Asia
